title: Ticket #6986: Vanilla-universe ckpt restarts nest extra condor_pid_ns_init calls
description:
Duncan Brown wrote to condor-users: 

I think this one is definitely a bug. I have USE_PID_NAMESPACES = True and
every time the starter restarts a user process after a checkpoint, it adds
another invocation of condor_pid_ns_init:

First time:

04/03/19 23:01:53 (pid:10486) Using wrapper /etc/condor/sugwg-job-wrapper.sh to exec
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/home/daniel.finstad/opt/pisn/bin/pycbc_inference --processing-scheme cpu --nprocesses 24 --fake-strain-from-file
[...]
04/04/19 03:00:03 (pid:10486) Using wrapper /etc/condor/sugwg-job-wrapper.sh to exec
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/home/daniel.finstad/opt/pisn/bin/pycbc_inference --processing-scheme cpu --nprocesses 24 --fake-strain-from-file
[...]
04/10/19 07:42:55 (pid:10486) Using wrapper /etc/condor/sugwg-job-wrapper.sh
to exec /usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
/usr/libexec/condor/condor_pid_ns_init
[...]

Without looking at the code, I'm betting we prepend condor_pid_ns_init to the command every time we start a process; the fix may be as simple as not storing the result.
